title: 2-time major champion Fuzzy Zoeller dies at 74
content: Fuzzy Zoeller, a two-time major champion and one of golf's most gregarious characters whose career was tainted by a racially insensitive joke about Tiger Woods, has died, according to a longtime colleague. He was 74.

title: Colts' Jones has lingering injury; insists he'll play
content: Colts QB Daniel Jones is battling a fibula injury but says he will be ready for Sunday's game vs. the Texans.

title: Bears CBs Johnson, Gordon off IR for Eagles game
content: Cornerbacks Jaylon Johnson and Kyler Gordon were activated off injured reserve prior to the Bears' flight to Philadelphia.

title: Sources: Warriors' Curry (quad) to miss week
content: The Warriors anticipate Stephen Curry will miss around a week with a quad contusion, depending on how he responds to treatment, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania and Anthony Slater.

title: Drinkwitz agrees to new 6-year deal with Missouri
content: Missouri has agreed to a new six-year contract with coach Eliah Drinkwitz with an average annual compensation of $10.75 million, the school announced Thursday.

title: Sources: Kelly officially fired by LSU without cause
content: The posturing over Brian Kelly's $54 million buyout from LSU is over, sources told ESPN, as the school sent him a letter Wednesday saying it is officially terminating him without cause.

title: Faulk expected to land Southern job, sources say
content: Former NFL star and current Colorado RBs coach Marshall Faulk is expected to become head coach at Southern University, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: McIlroy: Tour merger with 'irrational' LIV unlikely
content: Rory McIlroy doubts the fracture in golf will be repaired, as the "irrational" spending of the LIV series has created such a gulf in the sport.

title: Two more Thanksgiving NFL games: We have picks, predictions, storylines and more
content: Here's everything you need to know for Chiefs-Cowboys and Bengals-Ravens. Who will win the NFL's two remaining Thanksgiving games?

title: Inside the Chiefs' obsession with the Dallas Cowboys
content: Originally the Dallas Texans, the Chiefs were forced to leave Big D in 1963. They've had their eye on surpassing the Cowboys ever since.

title: How a Dak Prescott initiative saved a Cowboys exec with Stage 2 cancer
content: Dallas QB and the senior VP of communications look back on their friendship through a fortified bond.

content: The 2025 NBA Cup continues as group play wraps up. Here's everything you need to know about the third annual in-season tournament.

content: Breaking down the biggest storylines at Survivor Series: WarGames, including John Cena's final PLE match.

content: The Philadelphia 76ers star ran two dogs through the Purina Pro Plan Incredible Dog Challenge Agility Show while the show taped in Philadelphia.

content: Teams in playoff position on the holiday tend to stay there (77.1% since 2005). Who is in the best and worst shape?

content: We surveyed the sport on the biggest free agents and top trade candidates as baseball's hot stove heats up.

title: USMNT 2026 World Cup Big Board 3.0: Reyna, Scally back in the fold
content: We're closing in on the new year, and with months until the World Cup begins, which U.S. players are best positioned to make next year's squad?

title: Chaos for Barcelona and Liverpool, Arsenal No. 1: Reranking the Champions League
content: With just three games left, Arsenal look like the best team in the competition, while Barcelona, Liverpool and Man City are spiraling. Let's review how the UEFA Champions League looks after Matchday 5.

title: Talking points: Pep's tinkering costs City, Arsenal look unstoppable
content: Statement wins, coaches under pressure and bizarre team selections. ESPN writers break down Matchday 5.

title: Over the river and through the parlays: Thanksgiving is a sports betting holiday too
content: With big games and marquee teams on the menu, Thanksgiving week is among busiest of the year for sportsbooks.

title: Is it time for McLaren to prioritize Norris over Piastri?
content: McLaren has refused to favor one driver over the other all season, but as Max Verstappen closes in, should the Papaya outfit issue team orders?

title: WNBA CBA negotiations: Why players say league's latest proposal is 'slap in the face'
content: The Nov. 30 WNBA deadline is looming for a new CBA. The two sides continue to meet during the holiday week.

title: Fantasy fast break: Eric Moody on Mikal Bridges' durability, Kel'el Ware's rise and more
content: Eric Moody's fantasy basketball insights you need to know about, including Mikal Bridges' durability and production in New York, Kel'el Ware's second-year rise and more.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Fernandes among 11 Man United players facing exit
content: Bruno Fernandes is one of 11 players Manchester United are willing to let go in a major squad overhaul. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Bihar Congress leaders point out flaws after poll loss, but party high command sticks to vote chori
content: The leaders find fault with ticket distribution, “outsiders” being given tickets, lack of coordination with the RJD and leadership of the State’s AICC in-charge

title: After death of two basketball players, Haryana CM orders review of sports complexes
content: Haryana CM Nayab Saini expressed condolences over the deaths and announced ₹5 lakh as financial assistance to the families of each of the deceased

title: RGCB to be national metagenomics project hub
content: Programme aims to address the challenge of undiagnosed acute febrile illness, encephalitis, diarrhoeal diseases, and respiratory infections

title: A.P. govt. plans 29 new substations to meet imminent spurt in power demand
content: Energy Minister asks AP-Transco and DISCOMs to submit progress reports on transmission and distribution projects every 15 days

title: A.P. CM calls for adoption of TTD’s best practices in major temples in State
content: TTD’s web portal should be linked with the RTGS for monitoring, says Naidu; officials share plans to automate kitchen to serve anna prasadam to 2.75 lakh people per day

title: APCRDA project office bags IGBC Net Zero Energy rating
content: The Project Office at Rayapudi has become the first government building in India to receive the IGBC Net Zero Energy Rating at the design stage

title: Ratan Tata Hub launches ‘SPARK’ to nurture early-stage innovators in A.P.
content: The initiative aims to strengthen Andhra Pradesh’s growing innovation ecosystem by providing structured guidance at the formative stages of entrepreneurship

title: Hyderabad Police unveils revamped surveillance grid, EYES teams to boost CCTV reliability
content: Commissioner V.C. Sajjanar describes it as a major overhaul of how the city maintains and upgrades its surveillance infrastructure

title: CM vows to address issues of Amaravati farmers
content: Naidu assures that he will seek an exemption for farmers from the payment of capital gains tax for more time

title: Review tender issuing methodology to prevent loss to State exchequer: Kerala HC to Chief Secretary
content: PIL claims that tenders awarded by the Irrigation department for desilting reservoirs of the State were causing substantial loss to the public exchequer

title: Appear before court or face non-bailable warrant: Telangana HC to HYDRAA Commissioner
content: It was hearing a contempt of court case filed by a businessman accusing the HYDRAA Commissioner of willfully disobeying the HC order over his claims on Bathukamma Kunta lake land

title: How can teacher-BLOs decide citizenship, petitioners ask SC
content: Petitioners describe Election Commission’s decision as ‘dangerous and unreasonable’; counsel says EC devised SIR on the assumption that there’s huge influx of illegal immigrants into India; adds that Aadhaar is enough to prove voter eligibility

title: PETA slams passage of Assam law allowing festive buffalo fights
content: The Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (Assam Amendment) Bill, 2025, seeks to exempt the traditional buffalo fight during the mid-January Magh Bihu from the purview of a restrictive law

title: PM to attend annual police conference in Chhattisgarh’s Raipur
content: Discussions expected on left-wing extremism, counter terrorism, disaster management, women’s safety, forensic science and AI in policing; chance for senior police officers to share perspectives directly with PM

title: J&K police search homes of Jamaat members, masjids and madrassas
content: The large-scale operation forms part of continuing preventive measures aimed at identifying and neutralising networks attempting to covertly revive the activities of proscribed organisations

title: Munambam holding: BJP urges Centre to implead in Waqf Vedhi’s appeal against HC order
content: The party to implead in case, while Munambam native Philip Joseph has already filed a caveat, says BJP leader

title: When a convicted Sengottaiyan stood disqualified from contesting elections
content: In the year 2000, Mr. Sengottaiyan was convicted in two different corruption cases and sentenced to jail attracting disqualification from contesting polls under the Representation of People Act

title: Death Count In Hong Kong's Deadly Fire Rises To 83, Many Missing
content: Hong Kong authorities said on Friday the death toll from the city's worst fire in decades had risen to at least 83, as firefighters scoured torched high-rise buildings for scores of people still listed as missing.

title: Iranian Nobel Laureate Says "Permanently" Barred From Leaving Country
content: Iranian Nobel Peace Prize winner Narges Mohammadi on Thursday said she was permanently barred from leaving Iran, in a birthday message to her teenage twins who she has not seen for over a decade.

title: Non-Europeans To Pay 45% More To Visit Louvre Next Year: Museum
content: The Louvre decided on Thursday to hike ticket prices for non-European visitors by 45%, the Paris museum and...

title: 'Couldnt Sleep All Night': Survivors Recall Deadly Hong Kong Fire
content: Hong Kong's worst fire in almost 80 years killed at least 65 people in an eight-building apartment complex, with more than 250 people still missing.

title: Putin Says Russia Will Fight On Unless Ukraine Withdraws From Their Territory
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin said Thursday that Moscow would end its Ukraine offensive if Kyiv withdrew from territory Moscow claims at its own -- otherwise they would take it by force.

title: Delhi Pollution Crisis: 68% Seek Medical Help, 85% Face Rising Costs
content: More than 80 per cent of residents in Delhi-NCR surveyed reported experiencing persistent health issues, including chronic cough, debilitating fatigue, and respiratory irritation due to polluted air, according to a survey.

title: Indian Woman Found In Bangladesh 20 Years After Going Missing At Bengal Fair
content: A woman from Madhya Pradesh, presumed missing at the Gangasagar Mela in West Bengal nearly 20 years ago, has been traced to Bangladesh. Efforts are now underway to bring her back to India and reunite her with her family.

title: Mumbai Couple Arrested For Using AI To Create Fake Local Railway Pass
content: Police have detained a woman sales manager of a private bank and her engineer husband for allegedly creating a fake season pass for local railway travel in the Mumbai suburban network using Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools.

title: UP Businessman Killed In Dispute Over Colour Of Chair Cover; 3 Arrested
content: Three persons were arrested on Thursday for allegedly killing a 45-year-old tent businessman over a dispute involving the colour of covers used on chairs and sofas at a wedding function in the Ballia district, officials said.

title: "Cannot See Anything": Pilot's Last Words Before Kedarnath Chopper Crash
content: 'Cannot see anything, turning...' was the last message from the pilot of the 17-year-old helicopter that crashed near Kedarnath valley in June this year, killing all seven people onboard

title: 2 Coaches Of Passenger Train Derail In Jharkhand, Damage Overhead Pole
content: Two coaches of the Rampurhat-Jasidih EMU local passenger train derailed near Dumka railway station in Jharkhand on Thursday, damaging an overhead electric pole.

title: 2 Prisoners Saw Through Bars, Escape Using Bed Sheets In France
content: Two prisoners escaped from a French jail using bedsheets after sawing through the bars of their cell, a prosecutor said Thursday.

title: Indian-Origin Man Jailed For 10 Years For Conspiring To Smuggle Heroin To UK
content: A 57-year-old Indian-origin man who admitted to a conspiracy to smuggle heroin into the UK was on Thursday sentenced to 10 years of imprisonment, with a co-conspirator being jailed for nine years following a trial in south-eastern England.

title: JEE Aspirant, 17, Jumps To Death In Faridabad Over Exam Stress
content: A 17-year-old girl preparing for the JEE Main allegedly committed suicide by jumping from the 10th floor of Ador Society in Sector 88, Greater Faridabad, police said on Thursday.

title: 'No Such Guidelines': Indian Railways On Halal-Only Non-Veg Meals On Trains
content: The Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC), on Thursday, issued a clarification amid renewed concerns alleging that only Halal-processed meat is being used in non-vegetarian meals served on trains.

title: Allahabad High Court Quashes POCSO Case Against 'Happily-Married' Couple
content: Quashing criminal proceedings under the POCSO Act, the Allahabad High Court has observed that forcing a happily-married couple to face trial merely to record a hostile testimony would be an "irony of fate" and an "instrument of harassment".

title: Imran Khan Party's "Last Option" Ultimatum Amid Death Rumours
content: Chief Minister of Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province, Sohail Afridi said on Thursday that Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) was considering its "last option" to secure a meeting with PTI founder Imran Khan.

title: Telangana Court Warns IAS Officer Of Non-Bailable Warrant Over Contempt Case
content: The Telangana High Court warned senior IPS officer AV Ranganath, who is serving as commissioner of the Hyderabad Disaster Response and Asset Protection Agency, that a non-bailable warrant would be issued against him if he fails to appear in court

title: Hong Kong Fire Puts Its Iconic Bamboo Scaffolding Under Scrutiny
content: While the exact cause of the deadly inferno that swept across a Hong Kong apartment complex remains unknown, questions have been raised about the role of the bamboo scaffolding that enveloped the buildings at the time of the fire.

title: "Only About Bringing Us Together": Conrad Sangma's Unity Pitch At 'One North East' Rally
content: Addressing the 'One North East Unity' rally in Tripura, the leaders claimed that regional parties have little value to the national leaders.

title: KSCA elections: Karnataka High Court reserves order on K.N. Shanth Kumar’s plea against rejection of his nomination papers
content: Justice Suraj Govindaraj reserved the verdict after hearing the arguments on behalf of Mr. Shanth Kumar, the KSCA, the Electoral Officer, and the other contestants for the post of president - former cricket players B.K. Venkatesh Prasad and Kalpana Venkatachar

title: Seeking the people's mandate in absentia
content: Sainul Abideen, Indian Union Muslim League candidate contesting the Karingamana ward of the Thamarassery grama panchayat, has been in hiding since October 21

title: West Bengal School Service Commission releases full details of 1,806 ‘tainted’ teacher recruits
content: Calcutta High Court also directs SSC to publish in the public domain answersheets of candidates who took the recently held selection test

title: Supreme Court asks government to regulate abusive online content
content: Top court suggests ‘impartial and autonomous authority’ to vet content; it says that like free speech, rights of victims of online abuse have to be protected, and wants ‘preventive mechanisms’ in place

title: BJP flags ‘foreign-located’ X handles pushing ‘anti-India’ narrative; ‘diversion tactic’, says Congress
content: BJP claims some Congress leaders, State units have X handles located in the U.S., Ireland, Thailand; Congress points to an X glitch and notes that the BJP Gujarat handle also shows its location as Ireland

title: Telangana Rising 2047 - Information Bureau to generate alternative credit scores mooted
content: Non-credit data such as utility bill payments, e-commerce transactions and government tax payment records will be integrated to assess individual repayment discipline

title: LDF exudes confidence of winning a majority of local bodies in Ernakulam
content: The manifesto, titled Our District, Our Dream, proposes comprehensive development of the district based on a policy upheld by the LDF and rooted in foundational productive sectors

title: Heavy rain likely in A.P. for three days from Nov. 29 as cyclone Ditwah forms over Bay
content: Red alert issued for Nov. 30 for Prakasam, SPSR Nellore, Y.S.R Kadapa, Annamayya, Tirupati and Chittoor districts as very heavy to scattered extremely heavy rainfall is likely in these places

title: PM Modi meets Indian Women’s blind cricket team after T20 World Cup triumph
content: The members of the team presented Mr. Modi with an autographed bat while he also signed a ball for the team

title: Dance by 15 women candidates in Anthoor seeking votes goes viral
content: The Left Democratic Front candidates came together to perform an Oppana set to the tune of a Mappila song as part of seeking votes

title: Policemen should not act as ‘human machines’ and use excessive force: Madras High Court
content: Justice M. Nirmal Kumar quashes cases booked by CBI pursuant to the 2009 violent clash between police and lawyers inside High Court campus

title: Ayushman Bharat services in Assam’s private hospitals not suspended: National Health Authority
content: Reacting to allegations by Congress, the authority said the State government restricted 263 super-speciality procedures in empanelled private hospitals for greater treatment delivery through public hospitals

title: Kerala HC issues directions to prevent overcrowding at Sabarimala
content: Court asks authorities to ensure  that only persons with genuine virtual queue or spot-booking pass corresponding to specified date and time slot are permitted entry to the Sannidhanam

title: Take history to the people to counter Sangh Parivar narrative, says Kerala CM
content: Heinous attempts are being made in Kerala to spread divisive mentality and bring back regressive practices which had been eradicated, Pinarayi says at the international annual session of Kerala History Congress

title: TTD Executive Engineer 'arrested' in laddu adulteration case
content: Total number of arrests goes up to 10 in the case related to alleged use of spurious ghee in making Tirumala laddus during 2019-24

title: Gujarat government begins three-day ‘Chintan Shibir’ in Valsad
content: According to an official release, the sessions will focus on adopting a governance model that is more sensitive, technology-driven and transparent

title: Sachin Pilot accuses BJP of misleading voters over illegal immigrants
content: Congress leader questions Special Intensive Revision and Election Commission role in electoral roll exercise

title: Eight years on, Hyderabad Metro Rail faces growing pains
content: The three-corridor network that once promised seamless connectivity now struggles with overcrowded trains, neglected infrastructure, and no immediate relief in sight

title: AIADMK, TVK suggest changes to draft SOP for political meetings
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan ask them to submit their suggestions in writing on Friday

title: Four-year-old boy murdered in Sri Sathya Sai district
content: The boy was reportedly kidnapped from his anganwadi on Wednesday evening by a close relative and allegedly killed, say police

title: Leadership change: High Command hopeful of resolution in meeting on Saturday
content: Mallikarjun Kharge says Siddaramaiah and Shivakumar will be called for Delhi to settle the matter on power sharing

title: M.P. govt.’s show-cause notice to IAS officer over controversial remarks; brahmin bodies seek FIR
content: State government says remarks made by Verma prima facie amounted to “harming social harmony and creating animosity in the society” and fell under the category of “indiscipline and serious misconduct”

title: Udayagiri MLA assures support to kin of deceased TDP leader
content: Kakarla Suresh consoles family members of TDP leader Gottipati Prasad Naidu, who was murdered in daylight at Chintalapalem village in SPSR Nellore district

title: KSEB to take up repair of generator in Moolamattom  plant
content: Earlier, KSEB aimed to fix leakage in the main intake valves of generators five and six. During inspection, inlet valve leakage was found in generator four

title: Stir intensifies as contract workers lock main gate at NMDC plants
content: More than 500 workers participate in the blockade demanding that all recently terminated contract workers be reinstated immediately

title: A.P. Tourism ties up with Rapido to offer ‘Driver-cum-Guide’ services to tourists
content: Rapido drivers with high ratings will be trained by the Tourism Department on the State’s history, culture, hospitality and safety.

title: After complaints from MPs, CISF alters tenure and posting policy at Parliament
content: Tenure to be extended to four years from three to increase familiarity with MPs, says officials; personnel with clean service record and clear psychological examination record to be posted

title: Nifty50, Sensex hit lifetime highs: What's driving rally & is it sustainable? Explained
content: Stock market at record high! Nifty50 has crossed 26,300 and Sensex has gone past 86,000 for the first time. There is renewed optimism about the Indian stock markets - but is the current rally sustainable? Here's what experts have to say:

title: DKS vs Sidda: Shivakumar says ‘word power’ post misread; clarifies his remarks
content: Karnataka deputy chief minister DK Shivakumar clarified his "word power" social media post was intended for the legal fraternity on Constitution Day, not a political jab at Chief Minister Siddaramaiah.

title: G20 showdown: Trump torches SA over 'white genocide'; Ramaphosa fires back
content: President Trump has accused South Africa of genocide against white people, threatening to ban the nation from the G-20 summit and halt aid. South Africa's President Ramaphosa refuted these claims, calling them baseless and from a fringe group. The G-20's consensus-based nature makes unilateral expulsion unlikely, despite escalating global political tensions.

title: WPL 2026 full squads: Complete players list for all teams after auction
content: Deepti Sharma became the most expensive WPL auction signing at Rs 3.20 crore, with UP Warriorz retaining her. Other stars like Amelia Kerr and Laura Wolvaardt also fetched significant bids. Despite a large purse, UP Warriorz made strategic signings, while surprising unsold names included Alyssa Healy and Alana King. A total of 67 players were acquired.

title: ChatGPT 'hacked': Mixpanel incident confirmed; user emails exposed
content: OpenAI users, beware! A security lapse at analytics provider Mixpanel exposed limited API user data, including names and emails. While no sensitive information like passwords or payment details were compromised, OpenAI has cut ties with Mixpanel and is notifying affected parties. Users are urged to watch for phishing attempts and bolster account security.

title: 'Brainwashed online': J&K Police arrest 19-year-old man allegedly planning terror act
content: Jammu police apprehended a 19-year-old man from Reasi, suspected of being radicalized online by banned terror groups.  Authorities seized digital devices and are investigating his alleged links to Pakistan-based handlers. The arrest, based on credible intelligence, follows a case registered under terror-related charges, with ongoing interrogation to uncover further details.

title: 'JD to dump Usha for Erika': How Joy Reid normalised Hinduphobia, misogyny
content: Reid, wearing a t-shirt that says F*** Trump, F*** ICE, Free Palestine, Unoccupy Chicago, and a bunch of other messages which combined explain the dire strait in which the Democratic Party finds itself, casually claims that JD Vance will drop his “brown Hindu wife” Usha for “white queen” Erika Kirk.

title: Critical shift: India to open nuclear sector to pvt players? What PM said
content: India is set to open its nuclear energy sector to private companies. This move aims to boost energy security and technological advancement. The government plans to increase nuclear power capacity significantly by 2047. A new bill will be introduced to facilitate this major policy shift. This reform follows the successful opening of the space sector to private players.

title: Google chips threaten Nvidia: Stock drops $250B; claims 'we lead industry'
content: Nvidia's dominance in AI chips faced a significant challenge as Meta reportedly considers billions in spending on Google's competing AI processors. This news sent Nvidia's stock plummeting, while Alphabet's shares climbed. Google's TPUs are emerging as a credible alternative, potentially disrupting Nvidia's market hold.

title: Reed Sheppard’s girlfriend: Who is Brailey Dizney? A look at her life
content: Reed Sheppard, a rising NBA star with the Houston Rockets, shares a strong bond with his girlfriend Brailey Dizney. Their relationship began in their teenage years, marked by shared moments like prom. Dizney consistently supports Sheppard through social media, celebrating his achievements and offering encouragement. Their journey highlights a steadfast connection as Sheppard navigates his professional basketball career.

title: CM Kar'nataka': Seeds of rift sowed 2.5 yrs ago; Congress crisis explained
content: Karnataka's Congress faces a leadership showdown as the high command prepares to decide between chief minister Siddaramaiah and Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar. Supporters of Shivakumar are pushing for a promised power-sharing deal, while Siddaramaiah aims to complete his full term. A decision is expected imminently, with three potential outcomes on the table.

title: WPL auction: Full list of sold and unsold players, base price, top buys, and team details
content: The WPL mega auction kicked off with a bang as UP Warriorz secured Deepti Sharma for Rs 3.2 crore, the day's highest bid. Mumbai Indians nabbed Amelia Kerr for Rs 3 crore. Notably, Australian captain Alyssa Healy went unsold, surprising many as the auction unfolded for the 2026 WPL season.

title: 'Only one will win': Mark Cuban warns AI giants— 'overspending bubble could pop'
content: Mark Cuban has cautioned major AI firms like OpenAI and Google against excessive spending in the race for the most powerful models. He likens the current AI arms race to the 1990s search engine boom, predicting a potential bubble and winner-take-all outcome. Cuban believes true disruption will emerge from unexpected breakthroughs, not just incremental improvements.

title: Building Bengaluru 2.0: City bets whopping Rs 1.5 lakh crore on its infrastructure
content: Bengaluru plans a massive Rs 1.5 lakh crore infrastructure overhaul to become a global metropolis. The ambitious project includes urban tunnels, elevated roads, metro expansion, and improved waste and water management. While aiming to ease traffic, critics question its car-centric approach and environmental impact, advocating for greater public transport investment.

title: Fighting crime: UAE halts visas to Pakistanis; stops short of banning passport
content: UAE has significantly curtailed visa issuance for Pakistanis, narrowly avoiding a complete passport ban. This move, reportedly due to concerns over criminal activities by visitors, has caused considerable difficulty for Pakistani nationals seeking entry. Meanwhile, UAE officials highlight visa facilitation reforms, processing hundreds of visas daily at a new center.

title: It wasn’t easy”: Gisele Bündchen opens up about shock over Brady’s past
content: Supermodel Gisele Bundchen revealed the shock of discovering Tom Brady's ex was pregnant just two months into their relationship. Despite this, they married and she embraced his son, Jack. After over a decade of marriage, the couple announced their separation in October 2022, with Bundchen now a mother again and Brady reportedly single.

title: Candace Owens pulls show, claims Macron tried to harm her after Kirk’s death
content: Candace Owens has halted her show, alleging French President Macron plotted her assassination, a claim she reported to the White House and US counterterrorism teams. She also implicated the Macrons in Charlie Kirk's death. These accusations surface amidst a defamation lawsuit filed by the Macrons against Owens for her claims about Brigitte Macron's gender identity.

title: Edmonton Oilers rumored to target Pete DeBoer to replace Knoblauch
content: The Edmonton Oilers are facing growing pressure following their heavy loss to the Dallas Stars. Along with fans and analysts questioning Kris Knoblauch’s future as head coach. Speculation is mounting that Pete DeBoer, recently fired by the Dallas Stars. He could take over. This development has reignited debate over coaching strategies. Along with the Oilers’ path forward in the 2025 NHL season.

title: CIA link, Afghan evacuee: Details emerge of White House shooter; what made him turn to terror?
content: An Afghan man who worked with US forces in Afghanistan is accused of a violent attack in Washington. He had been resettled in the US after the war. This incident has led to a halt in Afghan asylum and refugee processing. The move impacts thousands of families. It also raises concerns among Afghan communities and US veterans who supported them.

title: Sam LaPorta injury timeline hints bad news as Lions brace for setback
content: Detroit Lions star tight end Sam LaPorta faces a likely season-ending back injury. He was placed on Injured Reserve after a Week 10 game. Coach Dan Campbell stated LaPorta's return chances are very slim. The team is adjusting its playbook for backup Brock Wright. LaPorta's absence significantly affects the Lions' offense as they head into crucial games.

title: 'Word' war: K'taka CM tussle turns ugly; Sidda takes open potshot at DKS
content: Karnataka's top Congress leaders, chief minister Siddaramaiah and deputy CM DK Shivakumar, engaged in a public spat on social media. Shivakumar alluded to a "secret deal" for a rotational chief ministership, while Siddaramaiah countered by emphasizing his commitment to a full five-year term and highlighting fulfilled promises. This open conflict signals a significant escalation beyond their supporters' verbal exchanges.

title: White House shooting: FBI says treating it as ‘act of terror’; Afghan national held
content: Two US National Guard soldiers were critically wounded in a shooting near the White House, now being investigated as an act of terrorism by the FBI. The suspect, identified as a 29-year-old Afghan national who entered the US in 2021, is also severely wounded. President Trump vowed severe consequences for the attacker.

title: Kyle Divine arrest rumors grow amid troubling stepdaughter accusations
content: Online fitness personality Kyle Divine faces serious allegations after a viral Instagram post detailed a chat with a sexual violence hotline. His 16-year-old stepdaughter reportedly claimed abuse and drug provision.  Divine was arrested on November 26 for contributing to the delinquency of a minor and child seduction, with his court date set for December 2, 2025.

title: Hong Kong fire tragedy: Toll rises to 83, 100s missing; flames still visible on Day 2
content: A devastating fire at a Hong Kong housing complex has claimed 65 lives, with hundreds still missing. The blaze, believed to have started in scaffolding, engulfed seven of eight towers. Three men have been arrested for manslaughter amid a corruption probe into the renovation project, as authorities investigate fire-resistance standards and consider phasing out bamboo scaffolding.

title: WB school jobs scam: SSC updates list of ‘tainted’ teachers; school names remain a mystery
content: The West Bengal School Service Commission has republished a “comprehensive” list of 1,806 tainted candidates today from the 2016 SLST, after the Calcutta High Court’s order. But while names, parents’ names, roll numbers and subjects are out, the schools they taught in remain hidden. The op-ed tracks nine years of rot in Bengal’s teacher recruitment scam, from SLST to Supreme Court.

title: Miracle rescue: Survivor pulled from gutted Hong Kong building after 24 hrs; toll rises to 65
content: A man was rescued alive after being trapped for over 24 hours in a Hong Kong residential blaze that has claimed at least 65 lives. Emergency crews continue to battle the intense fire, facing structural dangers and extreme heat as they search for dozens still missing.

title: Cong's Bengal dilemma: Who should grand-old-party target in 2026 polls - BJP or Mamata?
content: Prime Minister Modi's declaration of Bengal as the BJP's next battlefield follows a thumping victory in Bihar. Meanwhile, the Congress faces an existential crisis in Bengal, squeezed between Mamata Banerjee's TMC and the rising BJP, with its own relevance rapidly diminishing.

title: Don’t compromise on Vitamin D: Expert shares smart ways to use winter sunlight
content: Winter's low sunlight hinders vital vitamin D production, impacting immunity and bone health. Experts advise smart sun exposure, prioritizing midday for brief periods, and considering skin tone. Since sunlight alone is often insufficient, incorporating vitamin D-rich foods and supplements, guided by medical advice, is crucial for maintaining optimal levels throughout the colder months.

title: 'Tried to incite civil war': BJP attacks Rahul, makes big claim on 'X' accounts; Cong reacts
content: The BJP has accused the Congress of using social media accounts based outside India to shape domestic political narratives. Citing X's location-tracking features, BJP MP Sambit Patra alleged that several Congress-linked handles, including those of leaders and influencers, appear to be operating from countries like the US, Ireland, and Pakistan, pushing specific narratives against the government.

title: 'Next step UCC': CM Sarma after Assam bans polygamy; who is exempted?
content: The Assam Assembly has passed the Prohibition of Polygamy Bill, 2025, banning polygamous marriages across most of the state and imposing penalties for violations. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma stated the law is not against Islam and aims to promote true Islamic practices. The bill excludes Sixth Schedule areas and Scheduled Tribes.

title: Keep cucumber skin for more vitamins and minerals
content: Cucumber skin is a nutritional powerhouse packed with vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants. It supports digestion, bone strength, and skin health. Modern varieties are less bitter, making the skin palatable. Washing thoroughly ensures safety. Enjoying cucumbers with their skin on enhances meals with added fibre and essential nutrients. This simple change boosts overall wellness.

title: Meet Asha Sobhana, the first crorepati from Kerala at WPL auction
content: The action began innocuously, after the Delhi Capitals kicked things off at the base price of Rs 30 lakh. But the tempo surged swiftly as Delhi and UP Warriorz traded bids up to Rs 55 lakh.

title: Noah Gray injury update: Will Chiefs miss TE for Thanksgiving week 13?
content: Chiefs tight end Noah Gray has been ruled out for Week 13 after missing all practices with a concussion. Kansas City now turns to Robert Tonyan and Jared Wiley behind Travis Kelce as the team faces Dallas on Thanksgiving. Here’s what Gray’s absence means for the Chiefs’ rotation, their offensive plan, and Thursday’s high-pressure matchup.

title: Smriti Mandhana skips KBC shoot after wedding with Palaash Muchhal gets postponed
content: Kaun Banega Crorepati 17's silver jubilee celebration welcomed Indian women's cricket team players, but vice-captain Smriti Mandhana was absent. She missed the KBC shoot due to personal reasons following her wedding postponement after her father's hospitalization. Other team members and the head coach attended the special episode.

title: WPL Auction 2026: Who got whom - base price, final bid and team details
content: The Women's Premier League auction kicked off with a bang as Deepti Sharma fetched a massive Rs 3.2 crore, with UP Warriorz securing her via RTM. Sophie Devine also commanded a Rs 2 crore bid from Gujarat Giants. The fourth WPL season starts January 9, with matches in Navi Mumbai and Vadodara, advanced to accommodate the T20 World Cup.

title: Another setback for Hasina: Ex-PM gets 21 yrs in jail; children face sentencing
content: A Bangladesh court has handed former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina a 21-year prison sentence in three corruption cases concerning land allocations. This verdict follows a separate death sentence for her role in last year's protests. Her son and daughter also received prison terms. Hasina, in exile in New Delhi, denies the charges, calling them politically motivated.

title: WPL expansion on the cards? DC co-owner says 'BCCI is planning'; pushes for home-away format
content: Delhi Capitals co-owner Parth Jindal anticipates the addition of one or two new teams to the Women's Premier League (WPL) soon. He believes this expansion will enable the BCCI to transition the WPL to a home-and-away format, enhancing fan engagement and the league's growth. Jindal also highlighted the potential for increased popularity following India's recent Women's ODI World Cup victory.

title: Blake Lively Avoids Taylor Swift ‘Smear Campaign’ as Travis Kelce Stays Silent
content: Hollywood's once-tight Blake Lively-Taylor Swift friendship appears strained, with Lively's recent social media silence fueling speculation. This distance is reportedly linked to Lively's legal battle with co-star Justin Baldoni, which inadvertently involved Swift. Insiders suggest Swift is working to rebuild trust, indicating a complex, human dynamic behind the public perception of a feud.

title: CTET February 2026 registration begins at ctet.nic.in: Check details here
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education has opened the registration window for the CTET February 2026 cycle, with applications accepted online until 18 December 2025. Candidates must complete form submission and fee payment before the deadline. The exam will be held on 8 February 2026, with Paper-II in the morning and Paper-I in the evening.

title: 'Third-world parenting': Nalin Haley calls Ramaswamy 'creep'; who is desi MAGA backer?
content: Nalin Haley, son of Nikki Haley, has publicly criticized Vivek Ramaswamy's childcare proposals, calling them "third world parenting style." Haley, who advocates for strict immigration policies and has faced scrutiny over his own loyalty, is increasingly vocal on the right. This online spat highlights a growing divide within conservative politics.

title: Dharmendra prayer meet: Bobby Deol looks emotional; Rekha, Sidharth Malhotra & others pay respect
content: Bollywood's beloved Dharmendra was honored with a 'Celebration of Life' on November 27th, following his passing on November 24th, 2025. Family, including Bobby and Sunny Deol, alongside industry stars like Sidharth Malhotra and Jackie Shroff, gathered at Taj Lands End. Sonu Nigam performed iconic songs, reflecting Dharmendra's joyful spirit. Hema Malini shared a heartfelt tribute, remembering his enduring legacy.

title: 11 killed in China: Train runs over rly workers; what went wrong?
content: Tragedy struck in China's Yunnan province as a test train collided with railway workers, claiming 11 lives and injuring two. The devastating incident occurred during a seismic-detection equipment test at Luoyang Town railway station. Authorities have launched an inquiry into the cause of this severe rail accident, the region's worst in over a decade.

title: Vascular surgeon shares one simple exercise for people with peripheral artery disease
content: A vascular surgeon successfully treated a young patient at risk of leg amputation due to PAD with a structured intermittent walking program. This exercise regimen, involving brisk walking intervals followed by rest, promoted collateral artery growth, significantly reducing pain and restoring mobility, ultimately avoiding amputation.

title: Terror plot foiled: Police nab 19-yr-old Jammu teen; cops suspect Pak link
content: Jammu Police apprehended a 19-year-old for plotting a terror attack, with suspected links to Pakistan-based handlers.  Simultaneously, Kashmir Valley saw extensive raids targeting the banned Jamaat-e-Islami, aiming to dismantle terror networks.  Authorities seized electronic devices and documents during these operations.

content: the ACC's hope of having two teams qualify for the 12-team field is still alive . five ACC teams are still ranked above no. 24 Tulane, the only representative from a group of 5 conference . a gap remains in spite of the head-to-head win .

title: MLB offseason grades: AL champs land an ace as Blue Jays sign Cease
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if you're a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, we'll weigh in with what it all means for next season and beyond .

title: NFL Week 13's fashionable arrivals, featuring Aidan Hutchinson, Amon-Ra St. Brown
content: week 13 of the season kicks off on Thanksgiving and rolls right into a rare Friday game . the week is set to feel like a football runway from the jump . some stadiums called for full cold-weather gear, others just a light fall layer, and players dressed for every forecast .

title: Thanksgiving throwbacks from Lions, Cowboys top NFL Week 13 looks
content: the Baltimore Ravens will wear their classic threads on the holiday against the green Bay Packers . the combination includes a silver helmet, navy jersey and white pant look . it's a busy week for alternates as part of the league's John Madden Thanksgiving celebration .

title: Three bets on overreactions and mismatches of college football's Rivalry Week
content: this is a card of overreaction and straight mismatches . "Georgia is better than Pitt" is just lazy box score fluff with no premise . the Bulldogs are 121st in pressure with only 16 sacks, one of the most important indicators .

title: One genre, many audiences: A quarter century of sports movies, ranked
content: a seton hall sports poll surveyed 1,519 adults in the past quarter century . one title stood out as the defining sports movie of this century, according to a poll . "the blind side" was the sports movie Americans reached for most, edging out another .

title: Women: Texas, South Carolina to meet for Players Era title
